There is currently no screening programme for HCV in South Korea. One-off HCV screening and treatment of people aged 40â€“70 years is likely to be very cost-effective compared with the current practice of no screening.
409 Importantly, to reduce the incidence of HCV-related end-stage liver-related complications and mortality, a national screening programme should include a national health policy aimed at managing HCV in the South Korean population.
